org.sd.cio
Class RemoteFile

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.cio.RemoteFile

public class RemoteFile
extends java.lang.Object

Wrapper around a file that may exist remotely.

This places files into the current user's machine-level cluster cache.

  • A file that is local to the machine will be symbolically linked to the cache area.
  • A file that is accessible over a mount will be copied to the cache area.
  • A file that is otherwise remote will be rsynced to the cache area.
The file in the cache will be used as the local handle.

When a RemoteFile is closed, if keepLocal is false, then the locally cached link or copy will be deleted.

If the file already exists in the local cache area, no transfer or update will be done unless the forceCopy flag is true.

Author:
Spence Koehler

Constructor Detail

RemoteFile

public RemoteFile(java.io.File file,
                  boolean keepLocal)
Construct a handle to a remote file by placing it in the local cache area. If !keepLocal, then delete the copied file on close.

Don't force a copy if the file already exists and do allow the copy.

RemoteFile

                  boolean keepLocal,

                  boolean dontCopy)

generateLocalPath

public static final java.lang.String generateLocalPath(java.lang.String remoteFile)
Given a remote file path in the form of <machine>:<path> or /mnt/<machine>/<path>, generate a local path for the file under the current user's cluster/cache.

Returns:
the localPath or null if unable to parse the remote file.

generateLocalPath

protected static final java.lang.String generateLocalPath(java.lang.String machine,
                                                          java.lang.String path)

copyToCache

public static final java.io.File copyToCache(java.io.File source)
Copy the source file to the cache area if it is locally accessible.

If it is locally accessible over a mount point, then copy the file; otherwise, symbolically link the file.

Returns:
a handle on the cached file if successful or null.
